Method Detail

createPluginDeviceExecutor

public static AntChannelExecutor createPluginDeviceExecutor(AntPluginAntDevice pluginAntDevice)
                                                     throws RemoteException
Creates a new executor around the given AntPluginAntDevice's channel, and sets an AntPluginDeviceIdleTask as the idle task to forward events as if it was functioning without the executor.

Parameters:
pluginAntDevice - The device to use the executor on.
Returns:
The running executor.
Throws:
RemoteException - If the channel throws a remote exception.

doWork

public void doWork()
            throws RemoteException
Description copied from class: AntChannelTask
Executes the task. Tasks can access the ANT channel via the AntChannelTask.channel field. Note: By default message processing on AntChannelTask.onReceiveMessage(MessageFromAntType, AntMessageParcel)} is disabled until AntChannelTask.enableMessageProcessing() is called. During the execution you can use AntChannelTask.disableMessageProcessing() to synchronously disable processing.

Specified by:
doWork in class AntChannelTask
Throws:
RemoteException - After the task deals with this exception internally (usually by canceling the task) it should forward the exception which will then fire the AntChannelExecutor.IDeathHandler.

Description copied from class: AntChannelTask
Returns a name used to label the thread running this task and reported in error logging.

Specified by:
getTaskName in class AntChannelTask
Returns:
Identifying name of this task.

handleInterruptRequest

public boolean handleInterruptRequest(int interruptingTaskRank)
Description copied from class: AntChannelTask
Decides how to handle a request to interrupt this task from another task. This method is called in a lock mutually exclusive to AntChannelTask.onReceiveMessage(MessageFromAntType, AntMessageParcel) so incoming messages will be 'paused' while this function makes a decision and an 'interrupted' flag at the beginning of AntChannelTask.onReceiveMessage(MessageFromAntType, AntMessageParcel) would be guaranteed to be seen before any further message processing is done. Note: If you implement an interruptible task, after this method is called, AntChannelTask.doWork() must finish executing within one second to be useful, otherwise the interrupting task will abort anyway. Returns false by default.

Overrides:
handleInterruptRequest in class AntChannelTask
Parameters:
interruptingTaskRank - The AntChannelTask.getTaskRank() of the task requesting to interrupt. MAX_VALUE indicates the executor itself is requesting an interrupt and the thread will be interrupted regardless of the return value.
Returns:
False if this task will not or can not interrupt its current operation. True if this task will begin canceling itself, also, if true is returned the executor will also call interrupt() on the thread executing doWork().

onReceiveMessage

public void onReceiveMessage(com.dsi.ant.message.fromant.MessageFromAntType messageType,
                             com.dsi.ant.message.ipc.AntMessageParcel messageParcel)
                      throws RemoteException
Description copied from class: AntChannelTask
Handles any incoming Ant messages while this task is being executed and message processing is enabled. Note: By default message processing is disabled until AntChannelTask.enableMessageProcessing() is called.

Specified by:
onReceiveMessage in class AntChannelTask
Parameters:
messageType - The message type to handle.
messageParcel - The message data to handle.
Throws:
RemoteException - After the task deals with this exception internally (usually by canceling the task) it should forward the exception which will then fire the AntChannelExecutor.IDeathHandler.
